actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means, H. Rept. 95-742.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance with amendment, S. Rept. 95-762.
House agreed to Senate amendment with an amendment.

official_title: An Act to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 with respect to the treatment of mutual or cooperative telephone company income from nonmember telephone companies, and for other purposes.

summary.as: House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment
summary.text: (House agreed to Senate amendment with an amendment) Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that income received from nonmember telephone companies shall not be used in determining whether mutual and cooperative telephone companies qualify as tax exempt organizations. Provides that the lending of securities to a broker and the return to the lender of identical securities does not constitute a taxable sale or exchange of the securities and no gain or loss is recognized by the tax exempt organization. Provides that the payments on such securities loans are not to be treated as unrelated business taxable income for tax exempt organizations. Authorizes the use of the "completed crop pool method of accounting" by cooperative organizations engaged in pooling arrangements for the marketing of products with respect to currently open crop pools and crop pools opened prior to March 1, 1978.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that certain income from a nonmember telephone company is not taken into account in determining whether any mutual or cooperative telephone company is exempt from income tax.
An Act to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 with respect to the treatment of mutual or cooperative telephone company income from nonmember telephone companies, and for other purposes.
